alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued July 23 at 4:05PM AKDT until July 25 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM SUNDAY TO 4 PM AKDT MONDAY FROM KIPNUK TO TOGIAK/TWIN HILLS... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a High Surf Advisory, which is in effect from 10 PM Sunday to 4 PM AKDT Monday. * LOCATION...The southern Y-K Delta Coastline and the northern Bristol Bay Coastline, from Kipnuk to Togiak. * WAVES AND SURF...Storm surge will generally be 1 to 2 feet above high astronomical tide, and up to 3 feet for a brief period near Togiak. Offshore waves will be 4 to 9 ft through the period. * TIMING...10 PM Sunday through 4 PM Monday. The period of highest impact will be after 4 AM. * IMPACTS...Incoming higher waves along the coastline could produce areas of localized rip currents and coastal erosion.
info.instruction: A high surf advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing rip currents and localized beach erosion.
